raw_reviews.review_text:
I have used various other controllers to
                                      include the Elite 1, Elite 2 and Scuff.
                                      This controller beats them all without any
                                      doubt! This controller has the best
                                      response times i have ever witnessed in a
                                      cobtroller and its especially noticible
                                      playing games like For Honor where
                                      response times really matter. I have not
                                      had any stick drift issues once so ever,
                                      if you do get stick drift you just have to
                                      recalibrate them from the controllers
                                      menu. From the menu you can also customise
                                      lighting and many other features like
                                      remapping the back buttons, setting
                                      response of the analog sticks and triggers
                                      and even see your notifications from your
                                      phone. The original controller i bought at
                                      launch had an issue with its A button, I
                                      contacted Turtle Beach's customer support
                                      and they responded next day and had a new
                                      controller shipped free of charge that
                                      same day without any hastle. Between the
                                      hardware and the support Tuetle Beach has
                                      would definitely recomwnd this controller!

There is a lot to say about this
                                      controller. I go through controllers like
                                      bear goes through honey jars... I have had
                                      4 of these controllers so far. None of
                                      them have had any stick drift after a year
                                      of use. The ones I have returned were due
                                      to some of the perceived lack of QA in the
                                      early batches that were shipped out. In
                                      all cases of returns it was the shoulder
                                      buttons that would start to have issues.
                                      My current one doesn't have any of these
                                      issues. Issues: I have read other reviews
                                      about the anti-friction rings on these
                                      controllers wearing grooves into the
                                      sticks, I have not seen this and as I said
                                      I have had one in constant use for over a
                                      year. The only negative I really have for
                                      this controller is the placement of the
                                      menu buttons. The
                                      Menu/Start/Select/Whatever you call them
                                      now, button on the left side of the
                                      controller is too close to the stick. You
                                      have to really concentrate to get your
                                      finger around the stick to hit the button.
                                      But that doesn't cause issues in any of
                                      the games I play, but it may for some
                                      people. Comfort: The controller itself is
                                      very comfortable in the hand. It has a
                                      slight texture to the grips that keep it
                                      comfortably in your palm. The buttons are
                                      all responsive, though if you are used to
                                      Scuf you may feel that they are a bit
                                      "squishy" compared to the faced buttons of
                                      the Scuf. I tend to use my Stealth Ultra
                                      for Shooters and even rocket league. I
                                      also have a couple of Scuf Instinct
                                      controllers, as well as the newer Scuf
                                      Valor Pro Wired Controller which I also
                                      love. The stealth ultra is a very
                                      comfortable controller. The placement of
                                      the back buttons works perfect for my
                                      hands. I'll post some images of how my
                                      hand sits on them for reference.
                                      Performance: I tend to use my controllers
                                      in a wired scenario, though I have used
                                      this particular controller wireless many
                                      times using the included dongle. I keep
                                      the dongle in the charging cradle that
                                      came with the controller. The only
                                      downside to using it wireless is that
                                      there is a delay when you want to start
                                      your Xbox from a shot down state.
                                      Sometimes the dongle doesn't connect for
                                      up to a minute meaning the Xbox just sits
                                      there until. the dongle finally connects
                                      and sends the startup signal. Like I said,
                                      I tend to use it wired so I don't run into
                                      that issue. I don't notice any lag above
                                      what I would expect from a wireless Xbox
                                      controller when in wireless mode. The
                                      sticks themselves have a great feel and
                                      the built-in response curves of the sticks
                                      just feel right to me. That is one of the
                                      reasons I prefer this over my Scuf
                                      controllers for games like Call of Duty.
                                      The aim just feels better. There are
                                      multiple curves you can choose from in the
                                      settings. I tend to stick to the Precision
                                      setting, and I set all my dead zones to
                                      0%. It feels great and the aim is super
                                      responsive. The triggers are also very
                                      nice and the only thing I would change on
                                      them would be to make the trigger locks
                                      put the triggers into more of a mouse
                                      click feel instead of the current slightly
                                      squishier feel. There is not much travel,
                                      but compared to the mouse click, style
                                      trigger locks on my Scuf it just feels a
                                      bit soft. This doesn't affect my game
                                      play, but it is strictly a preference
                                      thing. The placement of the rear buttons
                                      is fine, I don't really have any pros or
                                      cons vs. other controllers. As with any
                                      controller the back buttons and their
                                      useability really hinges on how your hand
                                      lays on them and how easy they are for you
                                      to hit, without accidently hitting them.
                                      If they are awkward to you after a week of
                                      using it, you may want to try something
                                      else because if you can't feel comfortable
                                      with your back buttons, you will not get
                                      good muscle memory and will have to
                                      mentally stop to think about what you are
                                      doing when trying to hit them and that
                                      isn't good for any controller. So I highly
                                      recommend trying them out and also trying
                                      out some other controllers. Back buttons
                                      are not a deal breaker for some people,
                                      but if you do plan to use them, make sure
                                      you give it a good week of daily use to
                                      really see if they work for your hand size
                                      and shape and the way you hold your
                                      controller. Software: The software for the
                                      controller is fine for the most part, the
                                      issue I tend to have is that saving the
                                      settings back to the controller profile is
                                      not as simple as it should be. It can be
                                      confusing and is it feels like there were
                                      too many steps added. As you will see in
                                      the images, There are two menus that
                                      represent the memory profiles in the
                                      software and the onboard memory profiles.
                                      They do not always match up. And you would
                                      assume that you can just click the one you
                                      are adjusting in the software and then
                                      just match it up with the one you want to
                                      save it to on the controller, but you end
                                      up having to open another menu which makes
                                      it even more confusing. So the software
                                      could definitely use some more focus on
                                      UI/UX (I may be biased as I have been a
                                      software engineer and architect for over
                                      25 years). The lighting is fairly straight
                                      forward though the colors do have some
                                      apparently duplication, and are rather
                                      limited. I would like the option to set
                                      custom colors for some of the effects but
                                      most of them have pre-set color choices.
                                      Not a deal breaker, but should be
                                      something that is easy to add more options
                                      too. Most of these settings can also be
                                      done directly on the screen built into the
                                      controller as well which is a nice bonus.
                                      I have not used any of the app control
                                      buttons to tie it in with phone or social
                                      media apps, I just don't need that on my
                                      controller. Summary: I am very happy with
                                      this controller, and like I said I have a
                                      lot of controllers and tend to go through
                                      them pretty fast. I currently have 1
                                      Stealth Ultra that I use on my personal
                                      Xbox and PC in my office. I also have a
                                      Scuf Valor Pro in my office for when I
                                      just need a change. I have 3 Scuf Instinct
                                      Pro controllers, which I do enjoy, but the
                                      Stealth Ultra just feels better in game. I
                                      wish it had the trigger stops of the Scuf
                                      controllers, but that doesn't hold it back
                                      at all. I also have a few Xbox Elite
                                      controllers lying around, an old Razer
                                      Wolverine Pro, and have returned most
                                      other controllers (Nacon, Rig,
                                      Thrustmaster, etc...) My currently main
                                      daily drivers are the Stealth Ultra and
                                      the Various Scuf controllers depending on
                                      what I am playing and on which one of the
                                      Xboxes I happen to be playing on in a
                                      given day. We have a family of 4 who are
                                      all Xbox and PC, so when we play together
                                      as a family or have friends over we have
                                      plenty of options for controllers. I
                                      highly recommend this controller,
                                      especially if you play FPS games and need
                                      good aim. But like I said, test it out,
                                      see how it feels to you. I am a BestBuy
                                      Total Member, so I get an auto 24 month
                                      replacement plan on everything. So no harm
                                      in trying things out to find what works.

I own & use 4 xbox elite series 2
                                      controllers. i like this for regular
                                      everyday use. looked up the instructions
                                      & had no connection issues. Base needs
                                      to be plugged in to xbox and controller
                                      links to that wirelessly, not the dongle.
                                      did the configuration for sticks, no
                                      drift... unlike elite 2. battery at 56%
                                      after 10 hours. requires a little more
                                      patience & set up but is worth it.

This controller seemed great at first
                                      minus the extremely buggy software both on
                                      Android and Xbox. Although the software
                                      was a bit of a pain to get working, once
                                      it was setup it seemed to be a decent
                                      controller. Aiming feels a bit different
                                      coming from a Scuf Controller but that
                                      might be due to the controller using
                                      different response curves. Im sure with
                                      enough time, one can used to it. The
                                      biggest flaw has to do with the hardware.
                                      The anti friction rings that are supposed
                                      to make the thumb sticks glide nice and
                                      smooth when pushed all the way to the edge
                                      are not soft enough and after only a few
                                      hours of gameplay, the plastic on the
                                      thumb stick (left one on particular) have
                                      gouges in them from rubbing on the anti
                                      friction rings. They have actually done
                                      the exact opposite of what they were meant
                                      to do. Now, because the plastic has been
                                      scratched the thumb sticks do not glide
                                      smoothly at all. They feel like they are
                                      grinding when you rotate the stick. This
                                      is obviously something they wont be able
                                      to remedy with a software update and will
                                      probably end up having to recall all of
                                      the controllers they've sold until they
                                      can get this hardware redesigned and
                                      remade. I really wanted to love this
                                      controller, especially for its Hall Effect
                                      thumb sticks, but this just isnt it. I
                                      will be returning mine and hopefully
                                      Turtle Beach will get this figured out for
                                      a future iteration, but for now, I would
                                      stay away.

The controller works great, looks cool,
                                      connects well and is easy to swap between
                                      devices thanks to the UBS dongle and the
                                      profiles being stored on the controller
                                      instead of the xbox or pc. Easy to edit on
                                      the fly, too, with the screen on the
                                      controller. Pnly problem is the lights
                                      drain a lot of battery, and there isnt
                                      much significant change in the lights when
                                      i try to change the brightness, so battery
                                      life isnt quite as long as advertised.
                                      Still, good controller, feels nice, and
                                      still has decent battery life (longer than
                                      the ps5 dualsense edge, but not as long as
                                      the Xbox Elite Series 2).
